1907-2015 (bulk 1933-2003)
MS 3009-RG 3Collection processed by Melanie Rinehart, Samantha Brown, and Holly DeakyneThe processing of the Time Inc. Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.New-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024(212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2021-03-15T14:00:34Description is in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard The documents in the collection are in English.
New-York Historical Society
Time Inc. Reference Files
Time, inc.
MS 3009-RG 3
79.92 Linear feet in 19 document cases, 64 record cartons, 3 flat boxes, and 1 filing cabinet
1907-2015 (bulk 1933-2003) The Time Inc. Reference Files document the history of Time Inc. corporate divisions, the editing and publishing groups for the major titles, Home Box Office (HBO), and Time-Life Books; corporate decisions; office locations; books about Time Inc. and published by Time Inc.; franchises such as the Sports Illustrated "Swimsuit Issue" and Time "Person of the Year" (originally "Man of the Year"); personnel decisions, including those during World War II; and several staff organizations. Specific areas of interest in this collection include the Department Head Lists, which record the structure of the company and names and titles of top-level staff; and copies of FYI, an internal Time Inc. staff newsletter which discuss department and staffing changes, events and milestones, along with a card index of the contents. While the Reference Files seem to record the history of Time Inc. in a similar manner to the Time Inc. Subject Files, this record group may have, at one point, been organically created by departments sending copies of informative records to Time Inc.'s "central file." Most of the materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact manuscripts@nyhistory.org prior to your research visit to coordinate access. Keep in mind that it will take up to five (5) business days for collections to arrive, and you should plan your research accordingly.
Arrangement Note
Organized alphabetically based on the original arrangement. Some files may be physically out of order due to use by the Time Inc. Archives. This was not always corrected while processing, but a retroactive attempt was made to reorganize the finding aid.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers with the exception of restricted materials. Restricted materials may include privileged attorney correspondence; student records; medical records; personnel performance evaluations; contracts and agreements; and records with personally identifiable information. Restricted materials are located in box R6. Materials created within the past 35 years also may be subject to restriction on a case-by-case basis.
Unreformatted audiovisual material and digital material in the collection is not accessible.
Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use.
Use Restrictions
Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.
Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions.
Preferred Citation Note
This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Reference Files, MS 3009-RG 3, New-York Historical Society.
Processing Information Note
The Time Inc. Reference Files were processed by Melanie Rinehart, Samantha Brown, and Holly Deakyne in 2016. The original folders were retained although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding. Rinehart and Brown created the inventory and other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid. Deakyne made additions in 2019. Allen Thomas made additions in 2021.
Related Archival Materials Note
This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.
Scope and Contents Note
The Time Inc. Reference Files document the history of Time Inc. corporate divisions, the editing and publishing groups for the major titles, Home Box Office (HBO), and Time-Life Books; corporate decisions; office locations; books about Time Inc. and published by Time Inc.; franchises such as the Sports Illustrated "Swimsuit Issue" and Time "Person of the Year" (originally "Man of the Year"); personnel decisions, including those during World War II; and several staff organizations. Materials include press releases; handbooks and manuals; runs of employee newsletters and in-house organs relating to the entire company and from various departments and magazines; seventy years of staff-wide memoranda; and staff lists of department heads, correspondents, contributors, and subsidiaries.
Specific areas of interest in this collection include the Department Head Lists, which record the structure of the company and names and titles of top-level staff; and copies of FYI, an internal Time Inc. staff newsletter which discuss department and staffing changes, events and milestones, along with a card index of the contents; the Advertising Copy Acceptance department records from the 1930s to the 1960s regarding its mandate to maintain truth and integrity in the advertisements accepted for publication and documenting the reasons for rejecting an advertisement; and audio from interviews regarding the creation of Life World Library.
While the Reference Files seem to record the history of Time Inc. in a similar manner to the Time Inc. Subject Files, this record group may have, at one point, been organically created by departments sending copies of informative records to Time Inc.'s "central file." It isn't clear which department had ownership of that file or who was allowed to access it. The creation of Reference Files or the central file may have changed over time.
Provenance
Gift of Time Inc. in 2015.
Existence and Location of Copies
Digital copies of the Department Head Lists recording the structure of the company and the top-level staff are available in the N-YHS Digital Collections: Time, Inc. department head lists, 1949-1987.

Scope and Contents Note
FYI is an internal Time Inc. staff newsletter. The index cards contain names and subjects mentioned within the newsletter up through 2000. In 2002, Time Inc. began distributing the newsletter online. Along with the date of the FYI issue, the card may include a brief description of the article. The majority of index cards are for staff members. Also included are article subjects (banks, Dracula, hurricanes, journalim careers, lunch guide, military absentees, novels about Time Inc., running, typing contest); Time Inc. departments (Human Resources, Lecturers' Bureau, Letters to the Editor); and Time Inc. events (lease renewals of building, retirements, rubber tree arrives at Reception Center, TV filming at the Time and Life Building). There are also large sections for the Exhibition Center, Fortune, Life, March of Time, News Service, Sports Illustrated, Time, Time Inc., and Time-Life.

Scope and Contents
In 1970, Time-Life Books founding editor Norman Ross conducted interviews with Time-Life Books art director Edward Hamilton and Life World Library editor Oliver Allen about the creation of Life World Library, the first series published by Time-Life Books. Box 565 includes summaries of the discussion. These tapes were initially deposited with the Yale University archives, but transferred to Time Inc. in 1980.Time-Life Books: Oral history of Life World Library: Audiotape Reels [RESTRICTED]3452
